subject: Science
title: Introduction to Atoms and Elements
description: Learn about the building blocks of matter

content.text: Everything around us is made of atoms. Understanding atoms is key to understanding chemistry.

content.heading: What is an Atom?
content.text: An atom is the smallest unit of matter that retains the properties of an element. It consists of protons, neutrons, and electrons.

content.heading: Parts of an Atom
content.text: Protons: Positive charge, found in nucleus. Neutrons: No charge, found in nucleus. Electrons: Negative charge, orbit the nucleus.

content.heading: Carbon Atom
content.problem: Carbon has 6 protons, 6 neutrons, and 6 electrons
solution: The electrons balance the positive charge of the protons

content.heading: Questions
problems: What is the atomic number of an element with 8 protons?
If an atom has 7 protons and 7 neutrons, what is its mass number?
Which particle determines the element's identity?
